result.execSummary:
The defendant Casey A Neugent was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Casey A Neugent is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Casey A Neugent was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Casey A Neugent was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
COUNT ONE DISMISSED.

60 days to pay fine or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Casey A Neugent

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Paid $579.00 by GPS to cover both cases 14CF226 & 14CF482.

Cases heard: 14CF226 & 14CF482, Defendant Casey A Neugent in court with attorney Kim Marie Zion.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. In 14CF226, Court sentenced defendant to 2 months jail in each count, concurrent with each other. Jail start July 22, 2015 at 7 p.m. Huber granted under jail rules. $543 costs on count 2, $343 costs on count 3. (18 days jail credit).   In 14CF482, 2 months jail, consecutive to 14CF226 and all other sentences. Huber granted. $443 costs. (24 days jail credit). Posted cash bond applied. Sixty days to pay fine or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts.
Sentencing hearing on May 29, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
filed by Attorney Kim Zion.

Cases called: 14CF226 & 14CF482, Defendant Casey A Neugent in court with attorney Kim Marie Zion.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Complaint filed in 14CF482. Reading waived. Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant plead no contest to counts 2&3 in 14CF226 and ct. 2 in 14CF482. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment.  Cts. 1 in both cases dismissed. Disposition will be probation with conditions or jail time and costs.  Sentencing to be set today with Judicial Assistant for Br. 2
for the 2/25/15 at 2:45 P.M. Return Date - Br. 2
For Exculpatory Evidence filed by Atty. Kim Zion
with Motion to File Further Motions after Receipt of Discovery, Motion to Disclose Intent to use other crimes, wrongs and bad acts filed by Atty. Kim Zion
Affidavit of Mailing filed by the District Attorney's Office.
Filed by District Attorney Jane Kohlwey
Scheduling Order
Jury trial on March 5, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Casey A Neugent in court with attorney Jack Lindberg.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.  Information filed, reading waived. Defendant plead not guilty. Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued.

Defendant Casey A Neugent in court with attorney Mark Arthur Eisenberg.  Christine M. Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Reset requested.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 11, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Petition For Leave to File Additional Motions filed by Atty Kohlwey

Defendant Casey A Neugent in court, in custody by video with attorney Randall M Holtz.  Jane E Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. $750.00 cash bond, standard felony conditions, absolute sobriety, no violent/abusive contact w/L.V., waives time limits to prelim  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 11, 2014 at 09:50 am.  Hearing scheduled for July 24, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
